ColumnC: If paediatric FDC not available, use 6H (preferably dispersible tablets)
ColumnD: There is a lack of data on appropriate doses of rifapentine to allow use of 3HP in children aged <2 years There are no data for neonates; an expert should be consulted for advice on suitable TPT regimens

ColumnA: HIV-negative children aged ≥2 years and ≤25 kg body weight
ColumnC: If paediatric FDC not available, use 3HP or 6H
ColumnD: A paediatric formulation of rifapentine is not available A rifapentine 150 mg scored and dispersible formulation has been prioritized for development [b,c] A paediatric FDC for rifapentine and isoniazid is not planned for development

ColumnC: 3HR using adult FDC 1HP using adult formulation (age ≥13 years)
ColumnD: An adult isoniazid 300 mg/ rifapentine 300 mg scored FDC and an adult rifapentine 150 mg tablet are available

ColumnC: 3HR for children on EFV-based ART 3HP for older children on EFV ART (and able to swallow tablets)
ColumnD: For more details on TPT regimens to use with ART, see Section 7.1 Data on 3HP in children on DTG are not yet available

ColumnB: 3HP if on TDF, EFV, DTG or RALbased ART
ColumnC: 1HP (age ≥13 years) if on TDF, EFV, DTG or RAL-based ART 6H
ColumnD: For more details on TPT regimens to use with ART, see Section 7.1 (including dose adjustments for 1HP with DTG or RAL)
